'''Ethics''', sometimes known as '''moral philosophy''', is a branch of [[philosophy]] that involves systematizing, defending and recommending concepts of right and wrong [[action (philosophy)|conduct]], often addressing disputes of [[moral diversity]].<ref name="iep.utm.edu">''Internet Encyclopedia of Philosophy'': [http://www.iep.utm.edu/ethics/ "Ethics"]</ref> The term comes from the [[Ancient Greek|Greek]] word ἠθικός ''ethikos'' from ἦθος ''[[ethos]]'', which means "custom, [[Habit|habit]]". The superfield within philosophy known as [[axiology]] includes both ethics and [[aesthetics]] and is unified by each sub-branch's concern with value.<ref>''[[Random House Unabridged Dictionary]]'': [http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/axiology Entry of ethics investigates what is the best way for humans to survive, and what kinds of actions are right or wrong in particular circumstance like in the world we live in today.
+
'''Ethics''', sometimes known as '''moral philosophy''', is a branch of [[philosophy]] that involves systematizing, defending and recommending concepts of right and wrong [[action (philosophy)|conduct]], often addressing disputes of [[moral diversity]].<ref name="iep.utm.edu">''Internet Encyclopedia of Philosophy'': [http://www.iep.utm.edu/ethics/ "Ethics"]</ref> The term comes from the [[Ancient Greek|Greek]] word ἠθικός ''ethikos'' from ἦθος ''[[ethos]]'', which means "custom, [[Habit|habit]]". The superfield within philosophy known as [[axiology]] includes both ethics and [[aesthetics]] and is unified by each sub-branch's concern with value.<ref>''[[Random House Unabridged Dictionary]]'': [http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/axiology Entry on Axiology.]</ref> Philosophical ethics investigates what is the best way for humans to live, and what kinds of actions are right or wrong in particular circumstances.
 
Ethics may be divided into three major areas of study:<ref name="iep.utm.edu"/>
 
Ethics may be divided into three major areas of study:<ref name="iep.utm.edu"/>
 
*[[Meta-ethics]], about the theoretical meaning and reference of moral propositions and how their [[truth value]]s (if any) may be determined
 
*[[Meta-ethics]], about the theoretical meaning and reference of moral propositions and how their [[truth value]]s (if any) may be determined
